subject: Art & Design
title: The Fashion Cycle: Trends That Return
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Fashion Cycle: Trends That Return.

hook.text: Mom jeans were 'uncool' in 2005, 'ironic' in 2015, and 'essential' by 2020. Fashion is a circle, not a line.

buildup.text: The fashion cycle follows a pattern: introduction, rise, peak, decline, and eventually â€” revival.

discovery.text: Nostalgia drives revivals. Gen Z revives Y2K fashion. Millennials revived 90s grunge.

twist.text: Social media accelerated the cycle. Micro-trends now rise and fall in weeks, not years. The cycle is spinning faster.

climax.text: Some items transcend cycles: white t-shirts, blue jeans, black blazers. 'Classics' are trends that refused to die.

punchline.text: If you keep your old clothes long enough, they become fashionable again.
